messages: df895c63e09eb72c46ff61fa7a82cf1d (22:18): AndyCap: This (http://tinyurl.com/jf6or) says that the range can't be extended. Is that true? It would not be possible to attach a hula hoop antenna?

d91da07a8981c499ce044009a80d379f (22:47): hi! i successfully installed WLAN here. Now i wanted to encrypt all the stuff, but it doesn't work. On my linux howto it says that it is a WPA encryption, but on the laptop i just can activate WEP. Is this the same encryption or is the probleme there?
f3dddede7cafdc2312155376d854dfa0 (22:47): install wpasupplicant and xsupplicant, you should be able to get wpa from there
d91da07a8981c499ce044009a80d379f (22:49): OK, thank you. I try to configure this stuff now. if I have troubles i just ask here...
d91da07a8981c499ce044009a80d379f (23:05): hmm, i installed those packages (I'm on debian btw) i enabled xsupplicant but it doesn't work
d91da07a8981c499ce044009a80d379f (23:07): on iwconfig i can see this point:  Encryption key:off. Do i have to enable that with iwconfig, not with iwprev?
d91da07a8981c499ce044009a80d379f (23:12): isn't the wpa encryption supported in adhoc mode?

a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:19): it *could* be, I think, but adhoc wasn't ever updated for 802.11g, which would lead me to believe if you could get WPA working on adhoc it'd require sticking to that single chipset vendor to make it work well
d91da07a8981c499ce044009a80d379f (23:34): hmm, I want to use WEP now. How can i disable WPA now? I activated it with the following commands:
d91da07a8981c499ce044009a80d379f (23:34): # iwpriv eth-wifi set WPAPSK="wireless password"
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:34): Is there another tools like dhclient ?
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:36): How to automaticall connect to any access point if present..
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:37): Blissex, dhclient, does'nt connect at all. i have to do it manually every time.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:37): iwconfig dev0 essid "ANY" works on some platforms.
85dcbd89f497160a5aa43c6fe96ed64a (23:37): |lostbyte|: there are quite a few wireless autoconfig applets/d?¶mons around. Do a search on FreshMeat.net
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:37): madwifi, by default, connects to whatever has the most power around when in sta mode.
85dcbd89f497160a5aa43c6fe96ed64a (23:38): |lostbyte|: what they do is they keep probing the interface for ''heartbeat''. Then they bring it up. This applies to both wired and wirreless.
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:39): Blissex, so it cant be done with iwconfig <dev> essid any; dhclient <dev>
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:40): Which autoconfig tool you guys use ?
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:40): when your out doors with your laptop ?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:40): Microsoft Windows XP Wireless Zero Config
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:40): in linux (and I wish I could in windows) manually operate the card from the command line
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:41): Microsoft Windows XP Wireless Zero Config ?
85dcbd89f497160a5aa43c6fe96ed64a (23:47): |lostbyte|: for example if you use KDE, 'kwifimanager', but there are several others.
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:48): tried that on my friends laptop and its bad.
85dcbd89f497160a5aa43c6fe96ed64a (23:52): |lostbyte|: there are CLI variants too. I just call manually a script I wrote.
593f80693c138f68ed00969304f64762 (23:52): Blissex, Could i have the script ?
85dcbd89f497160a5aa43c6fe96ed64a (23:55): |lostbyte|: but it is very, very simplified.
1d0a06ee306027c79bad5a27dd2eea0c (00:11): 2500 MHz, 22 dB xmit, tx gain 22 dBi, rx gain 15 dBi, no cable loss.
